title: FIreFox Update Deleted Bookmarks
content:
Hi,

I work for the Help Desk for a major company. One of our users just got the recent Firefox udpate - options to create profile or ext. The users click 'exit' and it appears a new profile was created for her and she lost her all bookmarks. I have tried to 'launch previous profile' in the about:profile option but nothing happens. The new window does not launch the previous profile. Is there another solution? Please assist as the user has years and years of bookmarks that she relied on to run her department.

title: Settings specific to instance or window.
content: Sometimes at work I need to do specific tasks through a very locked down proxy. At the moment I tend to keep a separate Firefox window with Firefox network settings, and the sites that I use through the proxy. But what I'd really like to be able to do is just apply the settings to that window. I believe Chrome has the option to open separate instances of the browser. Is there a similar option for Firefox? That way I could still look up information in a different window while having my proxy connection open for my work windows. I'm tired of toggling my network settings.

title: Tesco online shopping not working
content:
Hi,

This has been an ongoing issue for a few months now. Sometimes I can't sign into the Tesco UK website with an error like 'not allowed to access from that server' or something like that. Then after a few tries I can log in, buy a load of things then when it comes to verifying the payment with my bank, it just sits there with the little circle going round and round and it never completes the payment.

I have to open Chrome browser, log into the Tesco website to complete the payment there. I've phoned Tesco before and the guy on the phone said they recommend Chrome browser but I've never heard of a company doing that before. Surely all browsers should work.

It's just a bog standard Visa card I'm using so what could be causing this?
creator: Jota64

title: FF89/90/91 : Page loading perf Issues
content:
Hello,

I am generating html based reports I open locally thru file://<path> protocol thru FF89. Pages load at light speed. As they are relatively big (12MB+), with icons and graphs. It takes generally afew secs to load. Upgrading to FF90 and 91(.0.2), same pages take up to 3 minutes to load or even more. Tryed to open page via http server installed locally and same occur.

Auditing FF processes (on Win10x64, I7 8Cores, 24GB Ram, SSD), CPU is at 13%, no IO or very few IOs. FF seems to not be responding and I need to kill processes thru task manager.

I disabled add-on (just Ghostery), drop and recreated new profile but without success. Tryed different settings, Removed smooth control, HW acceleration, ... no way.

Same pages loaded from same laptop using Edge or Chrome are loaded correctly, in time, and does not show so long delays.

Anything that can explain such perf dropdown ?

Thanks

Cheers from Belgium

Th Even FaceBook does time to time freeze (pages not loading imgs anymore or unresponsive buttons). Have to kill FB to resume. This slowness started with FF90 and increased with FF91
creator: thierry.faidherbe

title: Multi-Account Containers "Open this site in your assigned container?"
content: One time, when using MAC I accidentally set a website to always open in a different container. Now any time I attempt to launch this website, I receive the MAC prompt "Open this site in your assigned container?", where I have two options: Open in Current Container and Open in Assigned Container. There is also a checkbox labeled "Remember my decision for this site", however even if I tick this checkbox and select Open in Current Container, I still get this same prompt every subsequent time I visit this website.

title: Maximized Firefox window extends slightly into the display above it.
content:
When I Maximize Firefox, the top bar of the window extends a few pixels to the screen directly above the screen with Firefox displayed.

The same problem happens on both my PCs. It doesn't happen with any other programs, only Firefox.

I've uploaded two example images. In both cases Firefox is on the lower screen. The windows taskbar is at the bottom of the top screen. When the Firefox window isn't maximised the window doesn't spill over into the next screen. When Firefox is maximised, a grey strip of pixels can be seen spilling over into the next screen.

Running:

Firefox 91.0.2 (64-bit)

Windows 10 21H1 19043.1165

DPI scaling 100% on both monitors.

content: I have a doteasy email account that i like to access via a web page interface. title: Extensions automatically restart
content:
Today I clicked on the Ghostery button to temporarily disable it, to see if doing that would solve a problem on a Web site. (Doing so a few days ago had solved a similar problem on another site.)

But a few seconds after clicking the button to turn it off, and the button changing from blue to gray, the button automatically changed back to blue, turning Ghostery back on again.

So I tried the other extensions. (I have just a few.)

Each one behaved exactly the same way!

What has changed? What is going on?

I'll run a virus scan, but can't think someone would bother to write malware to do something that trivial.

Thanks, Bill Mathews FF 91.0.2
creator: sfbillm

title: Change the Number of "Top Sites" on my Firefox Home Screen from 8 to 10 Columns?
content:
Hello, I only use "Top Sites" on my Firefox Home screen. I wanted to change the number of Top Sites on my Firefox Home screen from 4 to 5 rows. I was able to change browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.topSitesRows from 4 to 5 rows. It works correctly.

I have a 24" monitor. FF currently has 8 columns. I have room for 10 columns. Is there any way I can change the number of columns from 8 to 10? I don't see any option for that and I have searched for it.

Thanks in Advance.
creator: Cypherdude

title: Australian Gov HTTPS (BOM) access problems - Weather/radar Site - Bureau of Meteorology (Australia) – not working under HTTPS and Firefox.
content: 31-August 2021 . Hi all, recently the Australian government , “Bureau of Meteorology” weather and radar – website has stopped working under HTTPS and FireFox – it does work under Microsoft Edge though (Yuk). . Unfortunately even if under the FireFox internal settings - you disable the need for a HTTPS connection – the website still kicks you out anyway – and any direct call to the site (http://www.bom.gov.au) – will just kick you to an endless loop of no achievement – by basically constantly telling you “you cannot use HTTPS” and the HTTP link provided just loops you back to the same place. . For now – the only solution I have found is to leave “HTTPS” on – and create an exception for every single page (very zzzzz). . So for me , I am only excepting and viewing the local weather radar page and getting all other info from other sources. . Machine specs - Win10 Pro , Firefox Version 91.0.2 (64-bit) . I have also (via Edge) – reported this to the “BOM” in Australia, . I hope this helps someone , as I cannot be the only person in Australia trying to access this site – but having to sign up - to report the problem here, I did find more than a bit off putting.
creator: ponytrekker
